publicwhip.spmotion: S2M-3448 Economic Opportunity of Biofuels <> (lodged on 24 October 2005) Brian Adam*, Nora Radcliffe*, Stewart Stevenson*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Shiona Baird*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3448<> Economic Opportunity of Biofuels (lodged on 24 October 2005) Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Donald Gorrie*, Patrick Harvie*
S2M-3448<> Economic Opportunity of Biofuels (lodged on 24 October 2005) Richard Lochhead*

S2M-3448<> Mr Jamie Stone: Economic Opportunity of Biofuels—That the Parliament supports the production of biofuels, including ethanol, biodiesel and vegetable-based oils, both as a boost to the economy and in keeping with obligations to the Kyoto Protocol; believes that biofuel production would also benefit farmers, particularly in areas such as the Highlands; recognises that green fuels are being used already in Sweden, the United States of America, Brazil and other countries, to the success of their agricultural economies, and considers that the Scottish Executive should continue to stimulate new renewable fuels projects through grants and petitioning Her Majesty’s Government to reduce taxation on all biofuels. Supported by: Brian Adam, Nora Radcliffe, Stewart Stevenson, Rob Gibson, Mr Jim Wallace, Mr Andrew Welsh, Shiona Baird, Eleanor Scott, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Donald Gorrie, Patrick Harvie, Richard Lochhead
S2M-3448 Economic Opportunity of Biofuels (lodged on 24 October 2005) Chris Ballance*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-3448*#* Mr Jamie Stone: Economic Opportunity of Biofuels—That the Parliament supports the production of biofuels, including ethanol, biodiesel and vegetable-based oils, both as a boost to the economy and in keeping with obligations to the Kyoto Protocol; believes that biofuel production would also benefit farmers, particularly in areas such as the Highlands; recognises that green fuels are being used already in Sweden, the United States of America, Brazil and other countries, to the success of their agricultural economies, and considers that the Scottish Executive should continue to stimulate new renewable fuels projects through grants and petitioning Her Majesty’s Government to reduce taxation on all biofuels. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
